title: Bridging Time Series Frequencies for Nowcasting
text: basic example:
code: library(bridgr)  gdp <- suppressMessages(tsbox::ts_pc(bridgr::gdp))  bridge_model <- bridge(   target = gdp,    indic = baro,    indic_predict = "auto.arima",    indic_lags = 2,    target_lags=1,    h=2 ) #> Dependent variable: gdp | Frequency: quarter | Estimation sample: 2004-04-01 - 2022-10-01 | Forecast horizon: 2 quarter(s)  forecast(bridge_model) #>    Point Forecast      Lo 80    Hi 80      Lo 95    Hi 95 #> 75      0.8359963 -0.1209672 1.792960 -0.6275531 2.299546 #> 76      0.5418210 -0.4300031 1.513645 -0.9444557 2.028098  summary(bridge_model) #> Bridge model summary #> ----------------------------------- #> Main model: #> ----------------------------------- #> Series:  gdp  #> Regression with ARIMA(1,0,0) errors  #>  #> Coefficients: #>          ar1  intercept    baro  baro_lag1  baro_lag2 #>       0.1769     -7.342  0.1575    -0.0962     0.0168 #> s.e.  0.1301      1.407  0.0125     0.0124     0.0126 #>  #> sigma^2 = 0.5576:  log likelihood = -80.82 #> AIC=173.63   AICc=174.89   BIC=187.46 #> ----------------------------------- #> Single indicator models: #> ----------------------------------- #> Series:  baro  #> ARIMA(1,0,2) with non-zero mean  #>  #> Coefficients: #>          ar1     ma1     ma2      mean #>       0.6719  0.5277  0.3281  100.9338 #> s.e.  0.0645  0.0793  0.0749    1.5678 #>  #> sigma^2 = 18.25:  log likelihood = -653.45 #> AIC=1316.91   AICc=1317.18   BIC=1334.05 #> Aggregation to low frequency: #> Using mean over values in corresponding periods. #> -----------------------------------

title: Estimate Bridge Model — bridge
text: target time series data frame representing target variable (dependent variable). format compatible tsbox package (See tsbox::ts_boxable()). indic time series, listof time series, data frame containing indicator variables (independent variables). must format compatible tsbox package (See tsbox::ts_boxable()). indic_predict character string vector specifying prediction method(s) indicator variables. Defaults "mean". Future updates add support methods forecast package. indic_aggregators character string vector specifying aggregation method(s) aligning indicator variables target variable. Defaults "mean". Future updates support custom weighting functions. indic_lags integer vector integers specifying number lags include indicator variables. Defaults 0 (lags). target_lags integer specifying number lags include target variable. Defaults 0 (lags). h integer specifying forecast horizon (terms target variable's frequency). Defaults 1 (next period). frequency_conversions named vector specifying conversion factors different time frequencies (e.g., days per week, weeks per month). Defaults c("dpw" = 5, "wpm" = 4, "mpq" = 3, "qpy" = 4). ... Additional arguments passed model, parameters forecasting methods forecast package (implemented future versions).

title: Estimate Bridge Model — bridge
text: object class model, containing following elements: target: standardized target variable. indic: standardized indicator variables. indic_predict: prediction methods applied indicators. indic_aggregators: aggregation methods used indicators. final_forecasting_date: calculated end date forecasting. Additional internal parameters summary statistics.

title: Estimate Bridge Model — bridge
text: bridge model aligns time series different frequencies slicing aggregating indicator variables match target variable's frequency. uses predefined rules frequency conversion alignment. function checks mismatches start dates aligns variables necessary. Future extensions include: Support sophisticated forecasting methods forecast package. Custom weighting functions indicator aggregation.
